intro: Psychotria hexandra var. kealiae, commonly known as the Hawaiian psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and coastal areas. It has a moderate growth rate and is typically shrub-like in form. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
